metadata.synopsis: If Mattis makes it to HAV and speaks with Karlach, he will recognize her from the Blood Wars. Karlach then will give him a good advice. If companion Wyll is nearby he will join the conversation.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Load SCL and set up the tiefling path using the debug book.2. Recruit Karlach as an avatar.3. In recon: goto -54; 27; 1404. Speak with Mattis.OR1. Load SCL and set up the tiefling path using the debug book.2. Recruit Karlach3. In recon: goto -54; 27; 1404. Talk to Mattis as Karlach while she is far from the party.

10.speaker: Mattis
10.text: Welcome to our humble - wait, are you Karlach?
10.context: NodeContext: Karlach is feeling a little chuffed at the positive attention here. She's trying to be a good role model but is also delighted that her reputation precedes her

39.speaker: Mattis
39.text: A lot of us were in Avernus. We saw you fighting. You were so good!
39.context: NodeContext: Karlach is feeling a little chuffed at the positive attention here. She's trying to be a good role model but is also delighted that her reputation precedes her

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: Well! I, uh - yeah. I guess I was. I mean, you should avoid fighting for devils if you can. But if you can't, it helps to have a good right hook.
53.context: NodeContext: Karlach is feeling a little chuffed at the positive attention here. She's trying to be a good role model but is also delighted that her reputation precedes her

32.speaker: Mattis
32.text: I saw you lay out a maw demon in two hits! Bam, bam! We were all like 'whoa'.
32.context: NodeContext: She's winding Wyll up a little/ bringing the focus back onto herself. This is a friendly tug-of-war rather than a very serious one.

19.speaker: Mattis
19.text: Ever heard of the Blade of Frontiers, kid? If you like monster-smashing, you might be a fan of his work.
19.context: NodeContext: She's winding Wyll up a little/ bringing the focus back onto herself. This is a friendly tug-of-war rather than a very serious one.

45.speaker: Wyll
45.text: Ever heard of the Blade of Frontiers, kid? If you like monster-smashing, you might be a fan of his work.
45.context: NodeContext: She's winding Wyll up a little/ bringing the focus back onto herself. This is a friendly tug-of-war rather than a very serious one.

59.speaker: Mattis
59.context: NodeContext: She's winding Wyll up a little/ bringing the focus back onto herself. This is a friendly tug-of-war rather than a very serious one.

38.speaker: Karlach
38.text: A lovely chap. Didn't kick arse in the Blood War, but that's neither here nor there.
38.context: NodeContext: She's winding Wyll up a little/ bringing the focus back onto herself. This is a friendly tug-of-war rather than a very serious one.

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: That's true - but he never got kidnapped by a devil either.
66.context: NodeContext: Still a friendly repartee but Wyll is tryign to get the uperhand and it might be getting a little arch.

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: No, he only sold his soul to one.
37.context: NodeContext: Still a friendly repartee but it's getting pointed now.

65.speaker: Mattis
65.context: NodeContext: Mattis is listening to Wyll and Karlach argue and trying to get waht they're saying. This is the breaking point in the humorous tension up to this point.

47.speaker: Mattis
47.text: Sorry, kid. Look, forget about us begrudgers and bruisers.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Sorry, kid. Look, forget about us begrudgers and bruisers.

36.speaker: Mattis
36.text: How'd you learn to fight like that?
36.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

42.speaker: Karlach
42.text: Had to. Life didn't pull any punches. It was up to me to learn to take a hit - and deal one back.
42.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

31.speaker: Mattis
31.text: I want to learn how to fight back, too. I'm sick of getting tossed around.
31.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: From the look of things, you've got your wits about you. A clever mind and a bit of style will take you a long way.
8.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Fight with those, and you may find you never need to use your fists at all.
54.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

49.speaker: Mattis
49.text: In that case, want to buy a lucky ring?
49.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: Even I'm not thick enough to fall for the same trick twice. But keep it up, kid, and you'll be scamming with the greats in no time.
52.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: Ha! Nice try, shorty. Keep it up, though, and you'll be scamming with the greats in no time.
60.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

18.speaker: Mattis
18.text: Heya - you're back! I was thinking... I didn't recognise you before, but you're... you're Karlach, aren't you?
18.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

55.speaker: Mattis
55.text: Welcome to our humble - wait, are you Karlach?
55.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

3.speaker: Mattis
3.text: A lot of us were in Avernus. We saw you fighting. You were so good!
3.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

15.speaker: Mattis
15.text: I saw you lay out a maw demon in two hits! Bam, bam! We were all like 'whoa'.
15.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: It was the favourite pet of a nasty demon called Bulwig. He wanted to skin me alive after.
33.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

64.speaker: Mattis
64.text: But he didn't. He couldn't. You're too strong.

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: I can't believe you saw that. You're too young for that.
1.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

22.speaker: Mattis
22.text: Eh. Apparently not. Anyway, I thought it was pretty great. He didn't stand a chance against you.
22.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

23.speaker: Mattis
23.text: Ever heard of the Blade of Frontiers, kid? If you like monster-smashing, you might be a fan of his work.
23.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

14.speaker: Wyll
14.text: Ever heard of the Blade of Frontiers, kid? If you like monster-smashing, you might be a fan of his work.
14.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

24.speaker: Mattis
24.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

26.speaker: Wyll
26.context: NodeContext: A sigh first. This is meant to be a funny exchange. Mattis doesn't know him, so this is his response, slightly despondent but funny.

48.speaker: Mattis
48.text: Anyway, um, Karlach how'd you learn to fight?
48.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

56.speaker: Mattis
56.text: Anyway, um, Karlach how'd you learn to fight?
56.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: Didn't have a choice. Life doesn't pull any punches for a tiefling kid on the Sword Coast.
46.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

29.speaker: Mattis
29.text: Oh man. I know. I want to learn how to fight back, too.
29.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: You've got wits. Style. Those will take you farther faster than brute strength - believe me.
13.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

6.speaker: Mattis
6.text: In that case, want to buy a lucky ring?

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: You just do. Go after whatever's in your way - do it with everything you've got.
4.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

0.speaker: Mattis
0.text: Hmm. Well I'm not too strong. But I'm pretty fast with my hands...
0.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

41.speaker: Mattis
41.text: Say, want to buy a lucky ring?
41.context: NodeContext: Devilish grin, preparing to scam the player

35.speaker: Karlach
35.text: Even I'm not thick enough to fall for the same trick twice. But keep it up, kid, and you'll be scamming with the greats in no time.
35.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Ha! Nice try, shorty. Keep it up, though, and you'll be scamming with the greats in no time.
11.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

50.speaker: Mattis
50.text: Ha! You were really gonna fall for it? You're lucky I like you, Karlach, or I would've taken you for all you're worth.

7.speaker: Mattis
7.text: I'll save it for the city. Lots of nobles strutting around with too much gold, right?

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Keep it, kid. You might need it.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: Careful, kid. Once you start, it's hard to stop.

21.speaker: Mattis
21.text: I don't want to hurt anyone. But I don't want them to hurt me. What... what do I do?

27.speaker: Mattis
27.text: I've been knocked around a lot. But I never had a chance to fight back.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: What can I say? I'm a natural born brawler.

2.speaker: Mattis
2.text: I'm not. I don't know how to do anything but run.

58.speaker: Mattis
58.text: How'd you learn to fight like that?

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: How long were you in Avernus?

57.speaker: Mattis
57.text: I dunno. A while. It all kind of blurs together. But we saw you fighting more than once. You were our favourite. No one could take you down - they barely landed a hit!

61.speaker: Mattis
61.text: Heya - you're back! I was thinking... I didn't recognise you before, but you're... you're Karlach, aren't you?
